By applying a multivariate, robust statistical approach, the researchers were able to increase the signal-to-noise ratio and achieve a more precise identification and localization of the products. Furthermore, the proposed procedure was also applied to spectra collected in situ on mural paintings, demonstrating the applicability and effectiveness of the machine learning algorithms in real-world scenarios. Overall, the utilization of machine learning algorithms in the study enabled a faster and more cost-effective identification and classification of modern restoration products.
